TEXT: CARDINAL . The Commission , in order to establish the facts which were disputed by the parties , conducted an investigation pursuant to former LAW ( a ) of the LAW . To that end , it examined a series of documents and appointed CARDINAL delegates to take the evidence of witnesses at a hearing in GPE DATE , which both parties attended . The Commission made the following findings as to the facts .

CARDINAL . The applicant lived in the village of ORG Akıncılar in the part of GPE that is not controlled by the government of the respondent ORG ( “ the northern part ” ) . He owned fields in the buffer - zone that separates the northern part from the area controlled by the government of the respondent ORG ( “ the government - controlled area ” ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Before DATE the applicant had several meetings with undercover agents of the security forces of GPE in the buffer - zone . At these meetings the possibility of trading in drugs was discussed . It was finally agreed that the applicant would deliver a quantity of drugs to CARDINAL undercover agents , PERSON of ORG ( GPE Dioxis DATE IDIN ) and PERSON of ORG ( Kendriki Ipiresia Pliroforion – KIP ) . The delivery was scheduled to take place in the government - controlled area near the GPE to GPE road on DATE . The meeting point was adjacent to the buffer zone .

CARDINAL . On TIME CARDINAL DATE a number of security agents , including members of ORG ( Mihanikiniti PERSON Drasis – MMAD ) , hid around the meeting point . They had been briefed that the applicant was potentially very dangerous . The aim of the operation , which was organised by ORG , was to arrest the applicant in flagrante delicto .

CARDINAL . The meeting took place as planned and the CARDINAL undercover agents tried to immobilise the applicant while he was delivering the drugs . The applicant hit them and started running towards the buffer - zone . CARDINAL of the MMAD officers present , PERSON and PERSON . ORG , gave chase . PERSON was the first to catch up with the applicant . A brief scuffle ensued in the government - controlled area . The applicant kicked PERSON who kicked him back . Then PERSON hit the applicant twice on the head with his firearm , once on the right side and once on the left . Mr ORG threw the applicant to the ground and a third MMAD officer , PERSON , who had arrived in the meantime , put a pair of handcuffs on him . Then the applicant was surrounded by a number of officers some of whom had participated in his arrest .

CARDINAL . NORP The head of the operation decided that the applicant should be taken in a car to PERSON police headquarters . Apart from the driver , there were CARDINAL officers in the car : PERSON , Mr NORP and PERSON , of ORG . Mr NORP sat with the applicant in the back of the car .

CARDINAL . When the car arrived at the police headquarters , the decision was taken to take the applicant to ORG . A fifth officer , Mr A. Vrionis , boarded the car for the second leg of the journey .

CARDINAL . When the applicant arrived in the hospital he was fully conscious , and able to communicate in NORP . PERSON asked him questions concerning his meeting with PERSON and PERSON and the selling of drugs . He noted the answers on a hospital form .
CARDINAL . The applicant was successively examined by PERSON , PERSON and PERSON in ORG on TIME CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On his admission to the hospital , the applicant had bruises on the face , a clean laceration to the ear , a clean laceration to the buttock , parallel injuries to the feet and long , linear , clean , uninterrupted injuries to the back in a quasi - geometrical pattern .
CARDINAL . On DATE officers of the GPE police force started an investigation into the case .

CARDINAL . On TIME , ORG held a hearing in ORG in the presence of the applicant . The judge , relying on the existence of a reasonable suspicion , the risk of absconding , the number of witnesses to be interviewed by the police and the severity of the charges , remanded the applicant in custody for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL police officers requested and obtained Dr Orphanidou 's permission to question the applicant . The police officers , one of whom spoke NORP , informed the applicant that he was suspected of drug trafficking . The applicant signed a statement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant met his lawyers , Mr PERSON , who practised in the government - controlled area , and Mr GPE and ORG , who had come from the northern part . The meeting took place in the applicant 's room in ORG in the presence of police officers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the police sought and obtained permission by Dr Hatziharu to examine the applicant . The applicant signed a supplementary statement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transported to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was visited by CARDINAL members of ORG in GPE ( ORG ) : the ORG Senior Medical Officer , Lieutenant - Commander PERSON , and PERSON of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in FAC . The applicant was assisted by an interpreter and was represented by PERSON . The judge , considering that the police had used the first warrant properly and that it was necessary that the detention should be continued for the police to be able to complete their investigation , remanded the applicant in custody for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to GPE police station . On DATE he received a visit there by his wife , PERSON , PERSON and Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON , Chief Humanitarian Officer of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appeared before ORG . He was represented by CARDINAL counsel , PERSON and Mr PERSON , the latter practising in the northern part . The charges were read out . The Attorney - General informed the court in writing that , given that there had been a police investigation , no preliminary inquiry was necessary . The police submitted the case file , which had also been sent to the applicant 's lawyers . The applicant 's lawyers stated that they reserved their position as to the applicant 's defence . They also stated for the record that the applicant had been ill - treated during his arrest and transport to Larnaka police headquarters . The court committed the applicant for trial on DATE . The applicant 's lawyers asked for his provisional release . The court ordered his continued detention because of the risk of absconding , the severity of the charges he was facing and the possibility that he would be convicted .
CARDINAL . The applicant was transferred to FAC . On DATE he was visited by PERSON , a private practitioner from the northern part .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , PERSON , Mr NORP , PERSON and PERSON of KIP were rewarded with a promotion for their contribution to the applicant 's arrest .
CARDINAL . On DATE Lieutenant - Colonel Tereso informed the Presidential Commissioner for Humanitarian Affairs of GPE of the following :

“ On DATE , DATE after his arrest , the ORG Senior Medical Officer examined Mr Yusuf [ see paragraph CARDINAL below ] at ORG and made the following observations : His head and face were swollen with many bruises on his cheeks and lips . His forehead was bruised with CARDINAL recent scars . His eyes were bloodshot , swollen and discoloured . He had a cut on his left ear which was recently stitched . This wound may have been inflicted with a knife or a similar sharp object . He had a superficial wound to his right wrist which was caused by his handcuffs . He had abrasions to his left forearm , right shoulder and both knees which could indicate an involvement in a fight or a struggle . He had CARDINAL cuts on his right buttock which were QUANTITY and QUANTITY long and recently stitched . These wounds were probably inflicted with a knife or sharp object . On his back he had many superficial , MONEY , particularly in his lower lumbar region . These scars on his back may have been caused by whipping or beating . He complained of a pain in his abdomen but it must have been muscular pain because the abdomen did not show signs of internal injury . Such muscular pain could be consistent with punching or kicking . PERSON was handcuffed to his hospital bed . It is the considered medical opinion [ sic ] that his injuries could not have been self - inflicted and that his injuries are consistent with being ill - treated in a fight or severely beaten , the condition of his wounds suggest that they were inflicted during DATE and his injuries indicated that they may have occurred over a period of time as his wounds were at different stages of healing . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG filed with ORG a nolle prosequi in the applicant 's case , in accordance with LAW .
CARDINAL . The applicant was released on DATE . Before his release he signed the following complaint to ORG :

“ I , the undersigned PERSON ( PERSON ) , hereby complain that as I was working in my market garden I was arrested by NORP policemen and tortured . On arresting me they hit me over the head with a baton or a heavy metal or wooden object . They kicked and punched me in the abdomen . They stabbed me CARDINAL or CARDINAL times in the buttocks with a knife . I was also injured . They cut off my ear with a knife . CARDINAL men attacked me and beat me . I lost consciousness . When I came to , they were cutting the soles of my feet with a knife or razor blade . I was screaming with pain . They hit me in the face and wounded me under the left eye . Blood started to flow from the wound . I was injured on the forehead , which also began to bleed . Someone ( a policeman ) thrust his fingers into my eyes as hard as he could . They did n't stop kicking me . CARDINAL of them hit me with his gun . I had injuries to my shoulders , which also began to bleed . They split my lips . My left eye was swollen up so much that I could no longer see . I was unable to speak and have absolutely no recollection of them taking a statement from me at the hospital . I therefore complain about all of these acts of torture and inhuman acts which they inflicted on me and respectfully request you to open an investigation . ORG am at your disposal for any further information on this subject . ”
The complaint was countersigned by a ORG officer .
CARDINAL . The applicant returned to the northern part immediately . On DATE he was visited by a journalist who photographed his wounds .

CARDINAL . On DATE there was a hearing before ORG . The prosecution did not appear . The applicant , who was not present , was represented by PERSON , who declared that he spoke NORP . The court found that , given the nolle prosequi filed by the Attorney - General , the applicant was discharged .
CARDINAL . Some time after the applicant 's release the PERSON magazine published in its DATE issue the following statement by the applicant :

“ I grow fruit and vegetables that are irrigated in a market garden to which I hold title . On DATE , towards TIME , I went there to turn off the irrigation system , which is near the greenhouse . As I went past the apparatus , I saw CARDINAL people coming towards me . When they approached , they said to me in NORP : ' Stay where you are . Police . ' I realised that they meant me harm and started to run to the village . As I did so , they began to fire at me with automatic weapons equipped with silencers . I heard a shot fly past my head and immediately dropped to the ground . At that point they set about me . They did n't say anything . They hit me . At some point I looked up and saw that there were CARDINAL of them beating me . They did so for a long time . Then I passed out . At TIME I received a shock . I do n't remember whether they used an electric baton or gas . I was semiconscious . In the meantime , they had dragged me and thrown me into the back of a jeep . When it started up , they continued to hit me . Then they began to torture me somewhere ; I did n't know where we were . They said that I was an MİT [ the NORP national intelligence agency ] agent , asked me whether there were other agents in the area , from whom I received my orders and all sorts of absurd questions of that kind while continuing to beat me without respite . At some point , a masked man arrived with a cutting instrument , something like a knife . He said that if I did n't speak he would cut my ear off , that if I did n't speak he would drink my blood . I must have blacked out as , when I came to , he was cutting the soles of my feet with a cutting instrument . I could n't see because I was tied up . I was in such pain that I passed out several times . Each time I came to , the torture would start up again . At some stage they laid me out on my back and pushed something like a bayonet into the upper side of my thigh . I screamed and passed out again . They carried on torturing me like that . I could n't cry out any more . But they continued to torture me like that . When I came to for the last time , I realised that I was somewhere else . They were no longer hitting or cutting me . I could n't see out of CARDINAL eye at all , but with the other , which was injured , I tried to make out where I was .

Later , I was told that after the torture session I was taken to ORG , but the hospital authorities , seeing how serious my condition was , had me transferred to ORG . I have no recollection of that whatsoever . I do not recall being transferred from PERSON to GPE . I have no idea how DATE went by in the meantime . They gave me painkilling injections . At some stage they put a table and chairs in my room at the hospital . CARDINAL police officers and a judge then came in . When the judge saw the situation he left the room . As he was leaving , I heard him say something about a lawyer . As I was later to learn , it was decided that I was under arrest . DATE the police officers again brought a table and chairs into my room at the hospital . I remember the second time better . I was lying in my bed . I had one hand handcuffed to the bed and an intravenous drip attached to my other arm . My feet were of course also attached to the bed . On this occasion the judge arrived with some lawyers . There were CARDINAL people in the room , most of them policemen . The judge had ordered that I be held in detention pending trial for DATE so that questioning could continue . As he left the room , the judge turned to me with a look of pity before walking out . ... ”
The statement was accompanied by CARDINAL of the photographs of the applicant 's wounds taken on DATE . At least some of them had been “ retouched ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG met the applicant at FAC , a hotel situated in the buffer - zone in GPE . The applicant was assisted by Mr PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant addressed the following letter to the President of ORG for the Prevention of Torture and Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment ( ORG ) :

“ When I was attacked by a team of armed NORP - Cypriot policemen in my field in the buffer - zone , I was first beaten indiscriminately until my senses were numbed and I passed out . When I regained consciousness , I was in a small room surrounded by uniformed men who verbally abused , intimidated and threatened me . There the NORP - Cypriot police asked me to sign a statement to the effect that ' President PERSON is intransigent , does not want peace and as a leader is misleading the NORP - Cypriot people ' . In return , I was offered money , a house and a job in what they called ' the free areas ' , i.e. GPE . I refused without hesitation . They got angry and started hitting and beating me again . I thought I would be beaten to death . I was punched and slapped across my face . Suddenly one policeman held my head tightly and another cut my ear . I totally blacked out . I came to my senses in a hospital . I was on a stretcher , chained and handcuffed . Again several policemen in civilian clothes approached me , their mouths full of profanity and threats , and again started hitting . They also pressed their hands heavily on my eyes , which really hurt . As a result of such pressure my eyes got bloodshot . In the middle of this ordeal a NORP - Cypriot nurse protested . She was shouting : ' This is enough ... do not hit ... he is wounded ... you brought him here for treatment but you are killing him . He is a human being . This is a sin , even if he is a NORP ... do we have the right to treat him this way , a wounded and chained man ... ' The police left me and walked towards the nurse . The NORP - Cypriot police were obviously well - trained and professional in torture methods . I do n't even recall if and when I gave a statement . But I recall that twice the NORP - Cypriot police made me sign false confession papers accepting NORP - Cypriot accusations . I was branded a ' dangerous smuggler ' and a NORP - Cypriot ' spy ' . In the hospital I was in chains , handcuffed to a bed and put on a drip and continuously given painkillers . The pain was excruciating . For a long time my bruised jaw hurt badly . I had difficulty even drinking water , let alone chewing . The NORP - Cypriot court was brought twice to the hospital , once on a DATE , because they were ashamed to publicly take me to court . ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG requested the applicant to keep him informed of the ORG 's investigation .

CARDINAL . The ORG , in the course of his investigation , questioned , among others , the police officers involved in the applicant 's arrest , the NORP - Cypriot doctors who had examined the applicant and PERSON . On DATE he issued his report . In respect of his CARDINAL DATE meeting with the applicant he recorded the following :

“ At the meeting , PERSON said that TIME on DATE , when he was busy watering his tomatoes in his vegetable garden in the GPE region , CARDINAL strangers in civilian clothes approached him , crossed the ' border ' and threw him to the ground without uttering a word . Afterwards , when he next opened his eyes , he found himself in hospital . He said that he had probably received a blow to the head in order to be knocked out . He had not tried to get away . Despite my repeated questions , Mr Egmez has not provided me with details regarding what exactly happened , the circumstances or what had happened to him . He said that he did not remember . He has also said that he has no recollection of having made a deposition on DATE ( DATE after his arrest ) , of being visited by his CARDINAL lawyers ( Mr PERSON and CARDINAL NORP - Cypriot lawyers ) at ORG DATE , DATE , of making a further deposition that same day or of being transferred to ORG . As I asked him how he had remembered all he had put in the letter [ he had addressed to the Ombudsman on DATE ] , he replied : ' What I know is that I was in physical pain but when I found myself in hospital and came to I still had blood running down by my eye . That was when I realised I had injuries to my ear , the soles of my feet and elsewhere on my body . The cuts to my feet were so bad that I am still unable to walk . ' At the end of our meeting , PERSON handed me some items , including a copy of the magazine entitled PERSON , first year , no . CARDINAL , DATE . ”

CARDINAL . According to the ORG 's report , the applicant had been ill - treated on the following CARDINAL occasions : first , by a group of MMAD officers , amongst whom PERSON , PERSON and Mr Ioannidis , during his arrest after he had been immobilised and , secondly , in the car that transported him from the place of arrest to PERSON police headquarters when he was in the company of PERSON , Mr NORP and PERSON ORG . The ORG considered that , on both occasions , the officers involved had acted with unprecedented brutality and without any respect for human life and dignity . The ORG transmitted his report to ORG , ORG and the Attorney - General , in accordance with section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Laws on the ORG .
CARDINAL . No criminal or other proceedings were instituted against any of the police officers involved in the applicant 's arrest .

CARDINAL . The Government accepted the facts as established by ORG . They added that it was the ORG who had encouraged the applicant to make the complaint to the ORG and who had then transmitted the complaint , together with ORG letter of CARDINAL DATE , to the ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant questioned the ORG 's findings of fact . In his view , the delegates had approached his case with a particular state of mind . He pointed out in this connection that , during the taking of evidence , they treated him as a drug trafficker , as opposed to a person suspected of drug - related offences . The applicant also submitted that the delegates were wrong in admitting vague descriptions of the events by the police officers involved in the incident . Finally , he pointed out that the delegates failed to pursue certain lines of inquiry .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's version was that he was not involved in drug trafficking . He was arrested in the buffer - zone by a large number of police officers in the presence of journalists . The police officers subjected him to physical violence before his admission to hospital in order for him to make a confession . He was under the influence of drugs when questioned . Finally , the decisions remanding him custody did not contain reasons .

CARDINAL . The applicant further claimed that , as a result of the ill - treatment to which he had been subjected , he was unable to work . He had developed serious psychological problems – for example , he could not submit himself to any external authority – , could not stand and had become bulimic and diabetic . In support of his allegations he submitted CARDINAL reports by PERSON , a psychiatrist from the northern part , CARDINAL dated DATE to the effect that the applicant suffered from “ post - traumatic reaction ” and needed lengthy treatment , and another dated DATE to the effect that “ having considered the treatment applied and the lengthy period that had passed since then , [ the doctor was ] of the opinion that the applicant 's illness had become permanent ” .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW of Cyprus provides :

“ The Attorney - General of the Republic shall have power , exercisable at his discretion in the public interest , to institute , conduct , take over and continue or discontinue any proceedings of an offence against any person in the Republic . Such power may be exercised by him in person or by officers subordinate to him acting under him and in accordance with his instructions . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides :

“ The Republic shall be liable for any wrongful act or omission causing damage committed in the exercise or purported exercise of the duties of officers or authorities of the Republic . A law shall regulate such liability . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the DATE to DATE Laws on the ORG provides :

“ ( CARDINAL ) If at the end of an inquiry ... the Ombudsman forms the conclusion that prejudice or injustice has been caused to the person concerned , he includes in his report a recommendation to the competent authority for the reparation of the prejudice or the redressing of the injustice ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Any other provisions in this PERSON notwithstanding , if at the end of the inquiry ... the ORG reaches the conclusion that the action complained of violated the human rights of the person concerned and could constitute a criminal offence , he transmits a copy of [ his ] report ... to ORG , ORG and the Attorney - General of the Republic . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of DATE Laws on the ORG provides :

“ No testimony or reply to a question or statement given or made by an official or any other person in the course of an inquiry by the ORG can be used as evidence against another person in court or in another inquiry or procedure . ”

CARDINAL . In most criminal cases the Attorney - General gives his consent for a preliminary inquiry not to take place . In such cases , a copy of the statement of each prosecution witness is served on the accused or his lawyer . The court then decides whether to commit or not without a preliminary inquiry .
